Postings.Text: ARTICLE - Greipel dodges crash and grabs race lead
VIDEO - Stage 1 wrap up by Phil Liggett and Paul, Sherwen
PHOTOS from Stage 1

Rohan Dennis (UniSA) finished the day in the young rider jersey. He was in the break and was relieved to cross the finish line.
“It was exceptionally hot today and the wind made it virtually impossible at times. At one point we were only doing 20km an hour,” said Dennis.
“At the finish I stayed well back to let the sprinters go, I am glad I did, when the crash happened I was able to avoid it and stay with the bunch,” added Dennis.

SANTOS Tour Down Under Stage One, Medical Report. In the wake of the crash 800 metres from the finish line the race doctor has reported the following. Mattéo Montaguti (ITA) - ALM: grazes and taken to Sports Med Adelaide for precautionary x-rays on his collarbone. Frédéric Guesdon (FRA) - FDJ: taken to Royal Adelaide Hospital for precautionary hip x-rays. Jurgen Roelandts (BEL) - LTB: also taken to RAH for precautionary neck xrays.

Here's what Stage 1 winner Andre Greipel had to say after his dramatic victory:

“I’m lucky that I won today. There has been a massive crash with 800 metres to go. My pedal got touched and I lost positions from about 5th to 20th. But I could bridge the gap. 


"Petacchi went from left to right, he didn’t care about the crash. He’s a big star but he shouldn’t do this. Two of my team-mates crashed. That’s all I care about after winning this stage. We had a really hard time today with the high temperatures.”

please note all riders involved in the crash were awarded the same time as the race winner because the accident happened inside the final three kilometres. The riders in the crash were: Jose Joaquin Rojas (ESP) - MOV, Matthew Brammeier (IRL) - OPQ, Matt Goss (AUS) - GEC, Robbie McEwen (AUS) - GEC, Jaroslaw Marycz (POL) - SAX, Leigh Howard (AUS) - GEC, Jacopo Guarnieri (ITA) - AST, Cameron Meyer (AUS) - GEC, Stuart O'Grady (AUS) - GEC, Victor Cabedo (ESP) - EUS, Luke Durbridge (AUS) - GEC, Dmitri Muravyev (KAZ) - AST, Dmitriy Gruzdev (KAZ) - AST, Gerald Ciolek (GER) - OPQ, Matteo Trentin (ITA) - OPQ, Gert Steegmans (BEL) - OPQ, Gregory Henderson (NZL) - LTB, Olivier Kaisen (BEL) - LTB, Robbie Hunter (RSA) - GRM, Heinrich Haussler (AUS) - GRM, Takashi Miyazawa (JPN) - SAX, Luca Paolini (ITA) - KAT, Steele von Hoff (AUS - Vic) - UNA, Thomas de Gendt (BEL) - VCD, Kenny van Hummel (NED) - VCD,Wouter Mol (NED) - VCD, Mattéo Montaguti (ITA) - ALM, Jurgen Roelandts (BEL) - LTB, Frédéric Guesdon (FRA) - FDJ

Official top 10: Stage 1 Santos Tour Down Under. 1:Andre Greipel (GER) - LTB 2:Alessandro Petacchi (ITA) - LAM 3: Yauheni Hutarovich (BLR) - FDJ 4: Fabio Sabatini (ITA) - LIQ 5: Daniele Bennati (ITA) - RNT 6: Christopher Sutton (AUS) - SKY 7: Jonathan Cantwell (AUS) - SAX 8: Xavier Florencio Cabre' (ESP) - KAT 9: Mark Renshaw (AUS) - RAB 10: Manuel Belletti (ITA) - ALM
Greipel's winning margin over Petacchi was about half a bike wheel.

Don't forget, live coverage online on and TV tonight from 6:30pm (Adelaide time).

A 45 minute race highlights program goes online at www.wideworldofsports.com.au/cycling with TV coverage
from 11.30pm – 12.30am on race highlights on Channel 9 and WIN.

He’ll be full of confidence but whether he has enough of an advantage to still be in ochre after tomorrow’s Adelaide Hills 148km stage from Lobethal to Stirling remains to be seen.
Let’s just hope today’s crash will allow all the contenders to be there too.

Clarke was caught with less than 2k’s to go and then it was down to the team “trains.”
And, as he showed on Sunday, Greipel has the strongest lead-out and despite Petacchi’s lunge, the powerful German claimed another STDU scalp.

The escape group was able to contest both the Jayco Sprints and the Skoda KOM, with Martin Kohler (SUI) - BMC winning the first Jayco sprint and Marcello Pavarin (ITA) - VCD the Skoda KOM. Rohan Dennis (AUS - SA) - UNA was the last of the escapees to be reeled in but once the race regrouped just past Sevenhill William Clarke (AUS - Tas) - UNA was one of many to try a late dash for glory.

Eduard Vorganov (RUS) - KAT bridged across to Rohan Dennis (AUS - SA) - UNA, Marcello Pavarin (ITA) - VCD and Martin Kohler (SUI) - BMC after about six k’s of racing and after 16 k’s of racing had built a lead of 10 mins. The peloton let that stretch to nearly 12 before beginning the long task to drag the gap back down to a manageable level.

Yauheni Hutarovich (BLR) - FDJ finished third in a stage that ended almost an hour behind race schedule and was the slowest since stage 3 2000. That stage took five hours and seven minutes to complete, todays's was 4:33.30. In extremely hot and windy conditions, the peloton headed north from Prospect, but despite the conditions three riders broke away and were soon joined by a fourth.

A photo was required the separate Greipel from sprint legend Alessandro Petacchi (ITA) - LAM but it was the powerful German who prevailed for his ninth STDU win. The finish was disrupted by a crash that eliminated several protaganists from the finale, with some of the affected riders from GreeEDGE.

Andre Greipel is the King of The Santos Tour Down Under again after his Lotto-Belisol team guided him to a dramatic win in the opening stage of the 2012 SANTOS Tour Down Under.
Once again the peloton timed its charge perfectly to catch the day’s breakaway inside the final five kilometres.
The race time of 4:33:30 was the slowest time since stage 3 2000, 185km Gelenelg to McLaren Vale when Stephane Berges scored a 160km breakaway win in 5:07.46.
Unofficial Cycle Instead Young Riders: 1: Rohan Dennis (AUS - SA) - UNA Hindmarsh Most Aggressive Rider: 1: Eduard Vorganov (RUS) - KAT
Unofficial SKODA King of the Mountains: 1: Marcello Pavarin (ITA) - VCD 2: Martin Kohler (SUI) - BMC 3: Rohan Dennis (AUS - SA) - UNA
Unofficial Jayco Sprint Points. 1: Andre Greipel (GER) - LTB 15 2: Alessandro Petacchi (ITA) - LAM 14 3: Yauheni Hutarovich (BLR) - FDJ 13 4: Fabio Sabatini (ITA) - LIQ 12
